revision.text: ==Cebuano== ===Etymology=== From {{der|ceb|es|llave||key}}, from {{der|ceb|la|clāvis||key}}. This and [[yabe]] seem to be more recent developments as they seem to be affected by [[w:Yeísmo|yeísmo]]. ''Yawe'' seems to be the most recent out of the two as the [b] lenited to [w]. If the word was borrowed earlier, it might have been *lyabe or *liyabe. ===Noun=== {{head|ceb|noun}} # [[key]] ---- ==Swahili== ===Verb=== {{head|sw|verb form}} # {{inflection of|sw|wa|-wa|ji-ma|plural|subjunctive|affirmative}} ---- ==Tagalog== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|tl|es|llave||key}}, from {{der|tl|la|clāvis||key}}. {{doublet|tl|liyabe}}. ===Noun=== {{tl-noun}} # [[key]] #: {{syn|tl|susi|liyabe}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|tl|yawihan}} ---- ==Wandala== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|mfi|jawe}} ===Etymology=== Ultimately from {{inh|mfi|cdc-pro|*ymn}}. ===Noun=== {{head|mfi|noun|head=yàwè}} # [[water]] ===References=== * ''Topics in Chadic linguistics 3'', volume 3 (2007)
